comment: I have had a lot of professors in my college career, but Jon Preston is by far the best professor I have ever had. I very, very, very highly recommend taking him if you can. Even if you don't need what he is offering, just sign up for his class so you can see what a great teacher is is.

he is a great teacher my favorite so far at this school. explains material very well and post all his lectures online where you can listen in class instead of write as fast as possible. if you dont understand something he is always willing to help you outside of class. he is also just a really nice guy

He loves what he teaches and has a way of communicating that make students comfortable. The Graphics class is tough, but very interesting with some fun projects. He responses promptly to emails and wants you to learn the subject. His tests are short essay, so you must read the book and pay attention. If you understand the concepts, you'll get an A.

He is very fair with grading, explains material very well, provides review sample questions weeks before tests and he is more than willing to help anyone who needs it. However, you have to study hard on the test and do well on the homework assignments if you wanna do well because you can't just breeze by with him. I give him a 5/5

A great teacher!  I had him for Gaming Development and Design.  He's very clear in what he teaches and all of the class discussions were relevant to the course subject.  He's very easygoing and his classes have a comfortable and amicable atmosphere that really help in understanding all of the material.  Always willing to help.  Highly recommended!

Took his CSE 1301 class with his lab, the game-based section; never bought book, still made A's on every test including the final (which was multiple choice). Takes excessive measures to keep tabs on students and make sure they understand, constantly worries that he's going to fast and asks for feedback. Best. Professor. Evar.

Very good professor, fun loving, and makes things interesting. Uses what he teaches in projects that have real applications. Does not use multiple choice tests, but lets you write out what you've learned. You'll need to study and remember what he's said to succeed in class. You can't just breeze by.
